page.title: 12THE M1 AND SPEED
page.content: We had a member of the Traffic Police come along to school to talk about the problems caused by the work on the M1. The numbers of speeders on the Northants stretch of the M1 (28 miles), April 84 - March 85 were: 1026 prosecuted, 1016 stopped and advised, 780 cautioning letters sent; most speeders were over 26. In a separate check it was found that the majority of speeders were in company cars. The fastest chase on the M1 was from Watford Gap to Dunstable in 15 minutes {42 miles - 160+ mph}. The most feeble excuse for speeding was "My wife is pregnant & I'm taking her to hospital": the man was travelling from London to Leeds at the time - {193 miles}. We thought that on a {proper road surface, with the right driver}, 80-90 mph was a safe speed. 43% of accidents were caused by roadworks & contra-flows.
